meanings.definition: Organicisms: living organisms that are part of a natural ecosystem.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, various organicisms like trees and animals thrive together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how organicisms in the ocean interact with each other.
meanings.sent3: The organicisms in the garden had a party and invited all the bugs.
meanings.sent4: The organicisms in the soil danced together, creating a harmonious symphony of life.
meanings.sent5: The organicisms in the pond shimmered under the sunlight, showcasing nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: Organicisms: the study of living organisms and their interactions.
meanings.sent1: Biology class focuses on understanding organicisms and their behaviors.
meanings.sent2: Researchers delve into the complexities of organicisms in their natural habitats.
meanings.sent3: The book on organicisms made the students laugh with its funny illustrations.
meanings.sent4: The field of organicisms is like a puzzle, with each piece representing a different aspect of life.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed a hidden world of tiny organicisms, each with its own story to tell.

meanings.definition: Organicisms: a belief in the interconnectedness of all living things.
meanings.sent1: Her deep-rooted organicisms led her to treat all creatures with kindness.
meanings.sent2: The philosophy of organicisms emphasizes the unity of nature.
meanings.sent3: His organicisms made him see the world as a giant family of living beings.
meanings.sent4: The web of organicisms connects every living being in a delicate balance.
meanings.sent5: The concept of organicisms is like a thread weaving through the fabric of life, binding us all together.
